abstracts.cdata!:
The project, to be implemented over five
            years, would assist the Government's efforts to start a
            plantation program on a significant scale and would
            strengthen its forestry management and planning capabilities
            through technical assistance to the Unit of Studies and
            Programming within the Ministry of Water and Forests. It
            would consist of a 20,000 ha plantation program as part of a
            68,000 ha program on four estates. It would include clearing
            20,000 ha of logged-over high-forest by force account and
            planting and maintaining short to medium rotation hardwood
            species. Risks of the project stem from its innovative
            nature and its scope. Although the species that would be
            grown have been successfully established over the past
            decade, this would be the first time that they would be
            grown in plantations. This is not expected to raise
            extraordinary difficulties, however, attention would have to
            be given to the technical operations, quality of the timber
            and promotion of the products.

0.cdata!: PROJET DE FORESTERIE EN COTE D'IVOIRE

abstracts.cdata!:
The Forestry Project for Ivory Coast, to
            be implemented over five years, will assist the
            Government's efforts to start a plantation program on a
            significant scale and will strengthen its forestry
            management and planning capabilities through technical
            assistance to the unit of studies and programming within the
            ministry of water and forests. It will consist of a 20,000
            ha plantation program as part of a 68,000 ha program on four
            estates. It will include clearing 20,000 ha of logged-over
            high-forest by force account and planting and maintaining
            short to medium rotation hardwood species. Risks of the
            project stem from its innovative nature and its scope.
            Although the species that will be grown have been
            successfully established over the past decade, this will be
            the first time that they will be grown in plantations. This
            is not expected to raise extraordinary difficulties;
            however, attention will have to be given to the technical
            operations, quality of the timber and promotion of the products.
